alert.note: Alert for Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 09 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream and creek flooding caused by excessive rainfall runoff is expected. * WHERE...A portion of WEST CENTRAL Maine, including the following county, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over dirt roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 625 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2.5 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional light rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain combined with runoff will result in minor flooding. This will impact streams and creeks around Dole Pond, Penobscot Lake and Long Pond. Washouts likely on Dole Pond Road and the Golden Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Somerset County - This impacts T4 R5 NBKP, Dole Brook Township, T5 R19 and Comstock Township. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
